Piratini, August 9, 1837. Senhor Antônio José Gonçalves Chaves.

The day before yesterday I received two of your letters dated the 9th of last month, and having to respond to them, I will begin with the first. I sent 1,500 pesos for the purchase of an item that was necessary for the State as well as 600$ to Renovato: and although I found no basis for my brother-in-law's order, it was good; because I only owe Renovato four hundred and sixty thousand réis, which Your Mercy

The Senhor Pelotas; I have already written to him about the paper money and he replied that he had sent it to Your Mercy.

Perhaps we shall see each other very soon there; and at this date I send my orders to have the slaves sent if they have been well treated at 16 pesos each, both in winter and summer. I will now proceed to your 2nd letter. The slaves, as I told you, belong to my brother-in-law João Rodrigues Barcelos; I made this clear to Victorica, informing him that if he did not approve or send for them, he should return the money I asked for in advance, which fortunately my wife had not yet received: therefore I am sending them to Your Mercy.

As for the jaguars I requested, it suffices that you only send me twenty, since I have been able to draw, etc., etc. I will write immediately to my father-in-law about what Your Mercy

I repeat that you will have me there soon, and then we shall talk at leisure. I wish you all prosperity for being truly your faithful and old friend.

(a) Domingos José de Almeida.

NB — Whatever Bernardina asks for must be sent, as she will take care of clothing the blacks as soon as they arrive there.

(a) Almeida.

Most Illustrious Senhor Antônio José Gonçalves Chaves, Montevideo.
